meanings.definition: To bestow excessive praise or recognition upon someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She overhonors her cat by throwing it a birthday party every month.
meanings.sent2: The teacher overhonors the student by giving them a gold star for every little thing.
meanings.sent3: He overhonors his favorite sports team by wearing their jersey every single day.
meanings.sent4: The company overhonors their top salesperson with a luxurious all-expenses-paid vacation.
meanings.sent5: The mayor overhonors the local hero with a grand parade and key to the city.

meanings.definition: To give more respect or admiration than is deserved.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity overhonors their fans by personally responding to every single message.
meanings.sent2: She overhonors her boss by always agreeing with everything he says.
meanings.sent3: The child overhonors their imaginary friend by setting a place for them at the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: The artist overhonors their muse by dedicating every painting to them.
meanings.sent5: The student overhonors the teacher by bringing them gifts every day.

meanings.sent1: The company overhonors their employees with extravagant bonuses for minor achievements.
meanings.sent2: He overhonors his dog by throwing it a lavish birthday party with a cake and presents.
meanings.sent3: The town overhonors their founding father by celebrating his birthday with a week-long festival.
meanings.sent4: The coach overhonors the team captain by naming them MVP every single game.
meanings.sent5: The school overhonors the valedictorian by giving them a scholarship to any university of their choice.
